title: Budget Highlights: Highest ever allocation for MGNREGA at Rs 48,000 crore
text:
NEW DELHI: Finance Minister Arun Jaitley has increased allocation for Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act to 48,000 crore from Rs 38,500 crore had been allocated for MGNREGA in 2016-17. 

Demonetization had raised expectations of higher allocation to MGNREGA. After the note ban, a large number of migrant workers went back home as small units were unable to pay wages. 

The demand for work in native villages of migrant workers was said to have increased after demonetisation. 

MGNREGA, aims to provide at least 100 days employment to the rural unemployed and underemployed by engaging them in rural infrastructure building. 

Launched in 2006 by the UPA government, it was expected that the NDA government might not promote the scheme as it was believed it involves work that adds little to the economy. But the NDA government has increased allocation top the scheme in its two Budgets.
